@description.name: @description
@description.body: This mixin offers basic event handling capabilities. It includes the commonly known methods for managing event listeners and firing events.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Class} Pointer to the regular event registration class

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object ? null} Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.
@param.description:
Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object, which is only called once. After the listener is called the event listener gets removed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object ? window} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: self {Object ? null} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean} Whether to remove the event listener of
   the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to remove the event listener of
   the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes an event listener from an event target by an id returned by {@link #addListener}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} The id returned by {@link #addListener}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check if there are one or more listeners for an event type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the object has a listener of the given type.
@return.description: Whether the object has a listener of the given type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: evt {qx.event.type.Event} event to dispatch

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Object<String,qx.Promise>} list of pending events, indexed by hash code

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {qx.Promise} promise that callers are waiting on, ready for when all events are finished

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal helper method to track promises returned from event handlers

@param.name: @param
@param.body: {var} result the result from the event handler
@param.description: the result from the event handler

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Waits for all pending events to be resolved

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an event on this object; equivalent to fireEvent, except that it always returns a promise

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected
@return.description:
a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create an event object and dispatch it on this object. The event dispatched with this method does never bubble! Use only if you are sure that bubbling is not required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create an event object and dispatch it on this object; equivalent to fireNonBubblingEvent, except that it always returns a promise. The event dispatched with this method does never bubble! Use only if you are sure that bubbling is not required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected
@return.description:
a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an non-bubbling data event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} User defined data attached to the event object
@param.description: User defined data attached to the event object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: oldData {var?null} The event's old data (optional)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an non-bubbling data event on this object; equivalent to fireEvent, except that it always returns a promise.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} User defined data attached to the event object
@param.description: User defined data attached to the event object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: oldData {var?null} The event's old data (optional)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected
@return.description:
a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected
